briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate the Glycemic Effects, Safety, and Tolerability of Exenatide Once Weekly in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (DURATION-5)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Has been diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus
* Has hemoglobin-specific A1c fraction (HbA1c) of 7.1% to 11.0%, inclusive, at screening
* Has a body mass index (BMI) of 25 kg/m2 to 45 kg/m2, inclusive, at screening
* Has been treated with diet and exercise alone or in combination with a stable regimen of metformin (MET), a sulfonylurea (SU), a thiazolidinedione (TZD), a combination of metformin and an SU, a combination of metformin and a TZD, or a combination of an SU and a TZD for a minimum of 2 months prior to screening
* Either is not treated with or has been on a stable treatment regimen with any of the following medications for a minimum of 2 months prior to screening:

  * Hormone replacement therapy (female subjects)
  * Oral contraceptives (female subjects)
  * Antihypertensive agents
  * Lipid-lowering agents
  * Thyroid replacement therapy
  * Antidepressant agents
  * Drugs known to affect body weight, including prescription medications (e.g. orlistat \[XENICAL®\], sibutramine \[MERIDIA®\], topiramate \[TOPAMAX®\]) and over the counter antiobesity agents

Exclusion Criteria:

* Has ever been exposed to exenatide (exenatide once weekly \[exenatide LAR\], exenatide BID, BYETTA, or any other formulation) or any glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) analog
* Has received any investigational drug within one month (or five half-lives of the investigational drug, whichever is greater) of screening
* Has been treated, is currently being treated, or is expected to require or undergo treatment with any of the following treatment excluded medications:

  * Any dipeptidyl peptidase 4 (DPP-4) inhibitor within 3 months prior to screening
  * Alpha glucosidase inhibitor, meglitinide, nateglinide, or pramlintide (SYMLIN®) within 30 days of screening
  * Insulin within 2 weeks of screening or for more than 1 week within 3 months of screening
  * Systemic corticosteroids by oral, intravenous, or intramuscular route; or potent, inhaled, or intrapulmonary (including ADVAIR®) steroids known to have a high rate of systemic absorption

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in HbA1c from baseline (Day 1) to Week 24 \[Week 24 - Baseline\].

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of \<7% at Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.5%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of \<=6.5% at Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline (Day 1) to Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Fasting Plasma Glucose Target of <=126 mg/dL
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentages of subjects achieving fasting plasma glucose target of \<=126 mg/dL at Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in body weight from baseline (Day 1) to Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in systolic blood pressure from baseline (Day 1) to Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in diastolic blood pressure from baseline (Day 1) to Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day 1) to Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in High-density Lipoprotein (HDL) From Baseline to Week 24
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in HDL from baseline (Day 1) to Week 24.

outcomeMeasures.title: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 24 to Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 24 to baseline (Day 1). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Major Hypoglycemic Events
outcomeMeasures.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject.

outcomeMeasures.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Minor Hypoglycemic Events
outcomeMeasures.description: The minor hypoglycemia category included events in which symptoms consistent with hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.
